text: Synergism between two distinct elements of the HTLV-I enhancer during activation by the trans - activator of HTLV-I .

We have conducted functional studies of the enhancer elements of human T-cell leukemia virus type I ( HTLV-I ) using the human T-cell lines Jurkat and MOLT 4 , which are negative for HTLV-I , and MT-2 and TL-Mor , which carry the proviral genome of HTLV-I .
Two distinct elements have been implicated in function of the HTLV-I enhancer .

One is the 21-base - pair ( bp ) core element that is responsible for trans-activation by the HTLV-I trans - activator <extra_id_0> p40tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and that has the ability to bind to <extra_id_0> cyclic-AMP responsive element binding factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CREB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - like factor ( s ) .
The other is a region interposed between the 21-bp elements .

In this study we demonstrate that a subfragment ( C26 ) in the region between the 21-bp elements is involved in trans-activation by <extra_id_0> p40tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , possibly through binding to an NF-kappa B-like nuclear factor or factors .
Formation of the protein - DNA complex with the C26 subfragment was positively affected by <extra_id_0> p40tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The C26 element conferred partial responsiveness to <extra_id_0> p40tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> when linked to one copy of the 21-bp element that , by itself , showed little activation in response to <extra_id_0> p40tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
However , the C26 element alone , even when repeated , could not be activated by <extra_id_0> p40tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , unlike other NF-kappa B - binding elements .
In contrast , the C26 element itself was profoundly activated upon stimulation with 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate .

These findings therefore suggest that the HTLV-I enhancer contains multiple functional elements , including binding sites for at least <extra_id_0> CREB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and NF-kappa B-like factors , which synergistically cooperate in activation of the HTLV-I enhancer in response to <extra_id_0> p40tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Our results also demonstrate that TPA - dependent activation of the HTLV-I enhancer may be mediated through the C26 element .
